Posted By: TheWrathofShane (7/29/2013 5:04:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ugh, this card's rarity is indicative of everything wrong with Magic since NWO. Having decent cheap removal at common is essential to a fun Limited environment. I get that new players don't like losing their Dragon to it, but the flip side is that it is infuriating to have to play any player's bomb and know that once it hits the table there is nothing to draw to, because you never saw an answer in the draft the game is essentially over before the match even began. Please Wizards, repeal NWO and bring back useful, first pick worthy cards at common. You are doing everyone that loves the game a huge disservice.
posts.html:
Ugh, this card's rarity is indicative of everything wrong with Magic since NWO. Having decent cheap removal at common is essential to a fun Limited environment. I get that new players don't like losing their Dragon to it, but the flip side is that it is infuriating to have to play any player's bomb and know that once it hits the table there is nothing to draw to, because you never saw an answer in the draft the game is essentially over before the match even began. Please Wizards, repeal NWO and bring back useful, first pick worthy cards at common. You are doing everyone that loves the game a huge disservice.

Posted By: sincleanser (7/22/2013 9:01:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ah, it feels so good to have a true restriction on a black kill spell again. I know some hate it, but I really think it's cool that some black magic simply doesn't work on black.   
  
No [Banishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banishing), no Doom, no [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror) is enough on a [Lord of the Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Pit), he comes from a place of Doom, Terror, and Banishment, which is exactly how I feel it should be.  
  
Either way, glad it's back; I also happen to think the platinum uncommon symbol really looks good against all that black :)
posts.html:
Ah, it feels so good to have a true restriction on a black kill spell again. I know some hate it, but I really think it's cool that some black magic simply doesn't work on black.

No Banishing, no Doom, no Terror is enough on a Lord of the Pit, he comes from a place of Doom, Terror, and Banishment, which is exactly how I feel it should be.

Either way, glad it's back; I also happen to think the platinum uncommon symbol really looks good against all that black :)
